conclusion: Analyze forces and use Newton's second law to find initial acceleration of block A.
Two wooden blocks A and B connected by a spring, block B is on the ground.
Weight of block A is \( W_A = m_A \cdot g \).
Spring force is \( F_s = k \cdot x \), where \( x \) is the compression.
A constant force \( F \) is applied vertically upward.
Initial spring compression is \( x = \frac{m_A \cdot g}{k} \).
Net force on block A is \( F_{\text{net}} = F - m_A \cdot g - k \cdot x \).
Net force simplifies to \( F_{\text{net}} = F - 2m_A \cdot g \).
Initial acceleration of block A is \( a = \frac{F}{m_A} - 2g \).
Final answer: Initial acceleration of block A is \( a = \frac{F}{m_A} - 2g \).
